25030cc4c31c21cde33","dweb:/ipfs/QmSUcZAp2fGGSuM3YteYJWbCbKL9nro44mJwp9XdvJBfgW"]},"src/contracts/common/lib/UnstructuredStorage.sol":{"keccak256":"0xeaf24a2ecc630946ac0a15efc2cdb850a3a9b73f70af935610f25d111abb4b6a","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://8b689386e8a50392230fda13d92674a6e34f18392032f46980eca24a7bd7329f","dweb:/ipfs/QmbZk9xaMX6TWUUpRG2jM2E2v6atyQGCVpbF3ytCG8xZYG"]},"src/contracts/common/utils/PausableUntil.sol":{"keccak256":"0x6c09c2d9481487f2a24a5230a5ec8e9ab35b930308c47b0e56b1013317e02344","license":"GPL-3.0","urls":["bzz-raw://ed226f4816f5f3ed87f05bfb71592dbe6d8b4fa0f4f6fda52426977d99b4ff4d","dweb:/ipfs/QmSmKsdzRdMzRfeP2kkJ3Fd8YJdo7ucAxmNFYytd12rNb6"]},"src/contracts/openzeppelin/5.2/upgradeable/access/AccessControlUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xb5e71dbbc4f2ebdd8749ebd66a79c4bed4118f5e203b97137ab41e0deb9af083","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://8464939fb037cb353aa40b06c0a71de591009ec07235118d40ca904be74437a5","dweb:/ipfs/QmYWfoCCFQ3Qo1SfBuVvBJVdC7Cz2N7pn7tWpdk7AV5EPB"]},"src/contracts/openzeppelin/5.2/upgradeable/access/extensions/AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x58a2e890d5528313d4ec0447e8d635ad536c5dcbdfff91d996abbe2d9f571ccf","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://5a7d3c0d134637358d724e3f2bf6fa71124b184577501346faaa8dd93a69165a","dweb:/ipfs/QmYSKzDqBckjnDYGVGm8XNW9FF68d8BzYCaYWvZwUvipkN"]},"src/contracts/openzeppelin/5.2/upgradeable/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xe129ef80a689a9545f86f1a7a8229663cb24ea2963e2f829ba0864236ffcc0a2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f3cc5566ae918dc8a6e6247fad509d5e2cbda34d19a652e5849ac9f8c60f2136","dweb:/ipfs/QmUAxxYPJJyHSHWkg9aYwXLvo6Wv1AzNcDagHdoxJ9pmw5"]},"src/contracts/openzeppelin/5.2/upgradeable/utils/ContextUpgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xf1d87faf8cb0cf4145e3497c94f9ca218080b5194a88f9e91b27911dae454dd4","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://e35f87523b586dafc4f243400b90fdbafaaa55f4fb03f196403e0239eb6d0993","dweb:/ipfs/QmSTZAo2XpBedCEiR8rKcNvbQFihWvgTo25toxN7jhZfWb"]},"src/contracts/openzeppelin/5.2/upgradeable/utils/introspection/ERC165Upgradeable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x3d4a13871ed650318ce561d294780d35e3d5bf3077e55555f2b591466c185f6d","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://ee112765cc76f5b3e005ec0f73f9abc5bb3b277d84e8e33373d1ea187498ba1e","dweb:/ipfs/Qmf6YrPAs1Q2Sir7qKsZuvsppJeFAbzdsyx1MNvYuYpwHi"]}},"version":1}

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getRoleMembers(bytes32).details: Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

pauseFor(uint256).details: Reverts if contract is already pausedReverts if sender has no `PAUSE_ROLE`Reverts if zero duration is passed

params._duration: pause duration in seconds (use `PAUSE_INFINITELY` for unlimited)

pauseUntil(uint256).details: Reverts if the timestamp is in the pastReverts if sender has no `PAUSE_ROLE`Reverts if contract is already paused

params._pauseUntilInclusive: the last second to pause until inclusive

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

resume().details: Reverts if contracts is not pausedReverts if sender has no `RESUME_ROLE`

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

PAUSE_INFINITELY().notice: Special value for the infinite pause

PAUSE_ROLE().notice: role that allows to pause the contract

RESUME_ROLE().notice: role that allows to resume the contract

getResumeSinceTimestamp().notice: Returns one of:  - PAUSE_INFINITELY if paused infinitely returns  - the timestamp when the contract get resumed if paused for specific duration  - some timestamp in past if not paused

isPaused().notice: Returns whether the contract is paused

pauseFor(uint256).notice: Pause the contract for a specified period

pauseUntil(uint256).notice: Pause the contract until a specified timestamp
